bill_title: prohibit an insurance producer from being the beneficiary on certain life insurance policies.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit an insurance producer from being the beneficiary on certain life insurance policies. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 58-10-6 be amended to read as follows: 58-10-6. No life or health insurance contract upon an individual, except a contract of group life insurance or of group or blanket health insurance, shall may be made or become effective unless at the time of the making of the contract such individual applies therefor for such contract or has consented thereto to such contract in writing , except . However, any consent to make the benefits under a life insurance contract payable to the insurance producer who sold such life insurance contract is void. The provisions of this section do not apply in the following cases: (1) A spouse may effectuate such insurance upon the other spouse . ; (2) Any person having an insurable interest in the life of a minor, or any person upon whom a minor is dependent for support and maintenance, may effectuate insurance upon the life of or pertaining to such minor . ; and (3) Family policies A family policy may be issued insuring any two or more members of a family on an application signed by either parent, a stepparent, or by a husband or wife.
